ch.phonon.drawables

Class AbstractDrawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.phonon.drawables.AbstractDrawable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Positionable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DrawableBox, DrawableCircle, DrawableLine, DrawablePicture, DrawableText

    public abstract class AbstractDrawable
extends java.lang.Object
implements Drawable, Positionable
    This abstract class implements some standard methods, that can be used by any Drawable implementation.
    Author:
    phonon

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      InvariantScalingType invariantScalingType
      invariantScalingType flag: Distinguishes different variants of invariantScaling

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractDrawable(StarPoint starpoint, LocalOrientation localOrientation)
      This main constructor needs to be called by all implementing classes and sets the starPoint, the initial and the actual local orientation of the Drawable.

    • Method Detail

      • transformViewPort

        public static java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transformViewPort(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform initial,
                                              TEMViewState temviewState)
        calculates a AffineTransform of the viewPort rotation/pan/zoom state based on the initial AffineTransform state and the TEMViewState associated to the TEMView.
        Parameters:
        initial - the initial AffineTransform state of the temView
        temviewState - the pan/zoom/rotation state of the TEMView
        Returns:
        viewPortTransform - the AffineTransform obtained by the transformations related to zooming, panning and scaling of the TEMView.

      • rotateWithViewPort

        public static java.awt.geom.AffineTransform rotateWithViewPort(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform initial,
                                               TEMViewState temviewState)
        Rotates an initial AffineTransform about the viewPort's rotation. Zoom/Pan states are neglected, only the rotation applied to the initial transformation.
        Parameters:
        initial - AffineTransform
        temviewState - pan/zoom/rotation state of the TEMView
        Returns:
        new representation of the view based on the temviewState

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D graphicsContext,
         java.awt.geom.AffineTransform viewPortTransform)
        This paint method implements and specializes the paint method in considering the invariant rotation and scaling in case of Drawable items that one need to keep the position but should not scale or rotate with the viewPortTranspform. To specify the invariance of the item, you need to use the setInvariantRotation(boolean) or /and the setInvariantScaling(boolean) function. In the case of invariant scaling, one can set certain constraints concerning the invariance of certain axis using the InvariantScalingType using the member invariantScalingType of the class.
        Specified by:
        paint in interface Drawable
        Parameters:
        graphicsContext - the graphic context to paint into.
        viewPortTransform - the actual transformation of the viewport.
        See Also:
        Drawable.paint(java.awt.Graphics2D, java.awt.geom.AffineTransform)

      • setInvariantScaling

        public void setInvariantScaling(boolean invariantScaling)
        Description copied from interface: Positionable
        Switches on and off invariantScaling. When true, the object is not scaled in size when zoomed. This allows to implement point representation always visible and independent of the TEMViewState.
        Specified by:
        setInvariantScaling in interface Positionable

      • getInvariantScaling

        public boolean getInvariantScaling()
        Specified by:
        getInvariantScaling in interface Positionable
        Returns:
        the InvariantScaling state of the item.
        See Also:
        for more information

      • setInvariantRotation

        public void setInvariantRotation(boolean invariantRotation)
        Description copied from interface: Positionable
        Switches on and off invariantRotation. When true, the object is not rotated about it's StarPoint, when temView is rotated. This allows to implement point representation always independent of the rotation state of the TEMViewState.
        Specified by:
        setInvariantRotation in interface Positionable

        public boolean getInvariantRotation()
        Specified by:
